meanings.definition: To perfume with incense or other sweet-smelling substance.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest censed the altar with a fragrant smoke.
meanings.sent2: The temple was censed with a pleasant aroma during the religious service.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally censed itself with incense while playing near the burner.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood censed the room with nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of flowers censed the garden, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To burn incense in honor of a deity.
meanings.sent1: The worshippers censed the shrine as a sign of respect to their gods.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, people cense their homes to seek blessings from the divine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally censed the statue of the deity with incense.
meanings.sent4: The prayers of the faithful censed the air with hope and reverence.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual censed the temple, filling it with sacred smoke.

meanings.sent1: The priest censed the church with a silver censer during the special service.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the incense censed the room, creating a serene ambiance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally censed the room with the swinging censer.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter censed the air with joy, like a censer spreading fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The evening breeze censed the garden with the scent of blooming flowers.
